StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Low Density Genotyping from the Fragile Families & Child Wellbeing Study

Person.Organization: PRINCETON UNIVERSITYUNIV OF MED/DENT NJ-R W JOHNSON MED SCHPENNSYLVANIA STATE UNIV HERSHEY MED CTR

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: Please cite/reference the use of dbGaP data by including the dbGaP accession phs002417.v1.p1. Additionally, use the following statement to acknowledge the submitter(s) of this study: Approved Users are expected to acknowledge the Submitting Investigator(s) who submitted data from the original study to an NIH-designated data repository, the primary funding organization that supported the Submitting Investigator(s), and the NIH-designated data repository (e.g., dbGaP). The acknowledgment statement should include the dbGaP accession number to the specific version of the dataset(s) analyzed.The Fragile Families and Child Wellbeing Study was made possible by generous financial support from the Eunice Kennedy Shriver National Institute of Child Health & Human Development (NICHD) to Sara McLanahan (Princeton University) and Irwin Garfinkel (Columbia University; R01HD36916, R01HD39135, and R01HD40421), as well as a consortium of private foundations, and to Daniel Notterman ((PI) Princeton University) and Colter Mitchell ((Co-I) University of Michigan; 5R01HD076592) and Lauren Hale (State University of New York Stony Brook (R01HD073352). FFCWS is a joint effort by Princeton University's Center for Research on Child Wellbeing (CRCW) and the Columbia Population Research Center (CPRC).

ConsentGroup.title: General Research Use (IRB, PUB)
ConsentGroup.name: GRU-IRB-PUB
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data is limited only by the terms of the model Data Use Certification. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Requestor agrees to make results of studies using the data available to the larger scientific community.
